text: Hello! I do have *Multiple checkboxes* field which options are to be closely tied with HubDB's table. Basically, I want the available choices to be taken out of one of the HubDB table. Is there a simple way to do it? Or at least, is there some kind of Forms API function which would let me to add field's by something like "addFormField()" instead of barbaric DOM Tree manipulation?
<@U7NGDL8TS> any chance you could look into this one?
There's no support for that atm :disappointed:

No way to do anything about it? No hack? Or even the name of the JS function I could leverage? I mean, I tried reverse engendering the JS library responsible for forms, but got discouraged along the way :wink:
hoped I could avoid it somehow

it is important to note that even if you manipulate the DOM you need to be careful about a few things:

• the forms script uses react and it can re-render the form at any stage and mess with your manipulation
• you have to make sure that the options you send are valid contact property values otherwise those values will not make it into the contact record (unless you are using strings in that case all is good)
